channel.title: Comments on: Connection Cloud Back Up
channel.description: Intermediate in flow properties between solids and liquids; highly viscous.

item.title: By: Mark
item.dc:creator: Mark
item.description: Seems Connection Cloud is no more again :( It looks like it was very nice. I'm giving Friend Graph a try, but it'd be nice to be able to check out Connection Cloud too.
item.content:encoded: Seems Connection Cloud is no more again üôÅ It looks like it was very nice. I’m giving Friend Graph a try, but it’d be nice to be able to check out Connection Cloud too.

item.title: By: Hal
item.dc:creator: Hal
item.description: Hey - connection cloud was one of my favourite apps on facebook and I just noticed that it's not there anymore. What happened?
item.content:encoded: Hey – connection cloud was one of my favourite apps on facebook and I just noticed that it’s not there anymore. What happened?

item.title: By: Ivan
item.dc:creator: Ivan
item.description:
Dude, you are my hero - electronics, graphs, PIC16F88! :) You have inspired a great lust in me with that cheap serial GPS reciever. About the graph in the picture - how much time did it take to plot it (I suppose you used graphviz for drawing?) and how many nodes are there in fact?
Warm regards, Ivan.
item.content:encoded:
Dude, you are my hero – electronics, graphs, PIC16F88! üôÇ
You have inspired a great lust in me with that cheap serial GPS reciever.
About the graph in the picture – how much time did it take to plot it (I suppose you used graphviz for drawing?) and how many nodes are there in fact?

Warm regards,
Ivan.

item.title: By: Emmanuel Lange
item.dc:creator: Emmanuel Lange
item.description:
The application is great to see how different groups of friends work, school, groups etc... would it be possible to port it to LinkedIn.
Em
item.content:encoded:
The application is great to see how different groups of friends work, school, groups etc… would it be possible to port it to LinkedIn.

Em
